intro: Serpocaulon sessilifolium, commonly known as the sessile-leaf serpocaulon, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are short and sessile, meaning they lack a stem and attach directly to the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
